intro: Philotheca nutans, commonly known as the drooping thyme-leafed grevillea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, drooping stems and small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Philotheca nutans is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
